me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit

Class ChatColorPalette

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.ChatColorPalette

  • public final class ChatColorPalette
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the palette that ChatColor uses to represent colors. Allows attempted matching of Colors to ChatColors.
    Author:
    codename_B, Glen Husman

    • Field Detail

      • CHAT_COLORS_TO_COLORS

        public static final com.google.common.collect.BiMap<org.bukkit.ChatColor,java.awt.Color> CHAT_COLORS_TO_COLORS
        An immutable map which maps ChatColors to RGB colors, as known by this palette instance. If this value is null, it indicates an unsupported change in the ChatColor enumeration order.

        This map does not contain keys for ChatColors which are for formatting only.

        Attempts to modify this map will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Due to the nature of the Google Collections API, it is possible to retrieve the inverse of this map, which maps colors to chat colors. This is an intended API feature, and can be used to map colors to chat colors exactly. Unless this is the indended result, it is recommended that this class be used for color matching, as it implements fuzzy matches.

      • FUZZY_MATCH_LEVEL

        public static final int FUZZY_MATCH_LEVEL
        The maximum tolerated difference in component levels by areIdentical.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MINIMUM_ALPHA

        public static final int MINIMUM_ALPHA
        The minimum value required in the alpha component of a color for matchColor to consider it non equal to ChatColor.BLACK.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • areIdentical

        public static boolean areIdentical(java.awt.Color c1,
                   java.awt.Color c2)
        A fuzzy matching function to grab colors that are very close together in RGB values to allow for some slight distortion. Does not account for the alpha channel.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first color.
        c2 - The second color.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the specified colors are a fuzzy match.

      • matchColor

        public static org.bukkit.ChatColor matchColor(int r,
                              int g,
                              int b)
        Get the closest known matching ChatColor to the given color.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component of the color.
        b - The blue component of the color.
        g - The green component of the color.
        Returns:
        The closest ChatColor in the palette.
        See Also:
        matchColor(Color)

      • matchColor

        public static org.bukkit.ChatColor matchColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Get the closest matching ChatColor in this palette to the given color. If the alpha value of the color is less than the minimum alpha value, this method will return ChatColor.BLACK.
        Parameters:
        color - The Color to match.
        Returns:
        The closest ChatColor in the palette.
